pin 1 5.1 Voltage /  pin 2 = No Voltage / pin 3 = 4.7 Voltage

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
Only one input fuse gets voltage at time; depending where the charger is connected.
R3105 must be soldered.

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
C7256 is near the CPU power supply; is not a good place for liquid spill.
CPU could be dead now.

Post diode mode to ground at F7000.

message: F7000.   diode mode 0,425 no short circuit

Post voltage and diode mode readings on LDO outputs of all CD3215 chips.

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
You have a problem on UB300/400 area.
Be sure all surrounding resistors are good.
Check UB090 solders/traces and related resistors.

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message: CB413 pin 1 is short circuited, so I removed the CB413 and DZB552 on the same line. But cb413 pin 1 is still short circuited, however RB302 pin 1 is short circuited. Should I replace UB300 and UB400?

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
Seems to be the case here.
Once the chips are removed, check if short is gone; before resolder new one.

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
I Removed the UB300 and UB400. There is no short circuit on CB413 pin1. But RB302 pin1 is shorted. When I checked from the schematic, I saw that the value of RB302 was 0. So it is normal to show a short circuit with the ground. I removed the UB300 in vain. I understand you didn't check. It escaped my notice.

2.
When I look at the schematic, it says r3033 is not in place. But r3033 is in place and shows short circuit. the diagram shows the value as 100k. I did not understand this situation. Is it normal for it to be short circuited or should I replace it with another 100k resistor? I added the pictures about it
 Also, when UB300 and UB400 are not in place, will the device turn on via other usb? Or do they absolutely have to be?

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
All CD3215 chips must be placed on the board.

Compare R3033/34 and their lines to ground in diode mode.

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message: I guess you didn't read what I wrote. The value of R3033/34 appears as 100k and no stuff in the diagram, but there are these parts on the motherboard and when I measure it, the values are 0 ohms. When I remove the R3033/34 and measure its 1st pin with ground, there is no short circuit. 0.504 shows up in diode mode. Is the value of these resistors really 0 or should it be 100k as written in the diagram?

message:
"I guess you didn't read what I wrote."
Yeah, I do NOT see any mention about R3034 in your previous post!
Did YOU read what you've wrote?

I don't have 00928 board on hand now.
But I can confirm with 00281; the same resistors are used for the same signals.
R3033 is soldered and has 0 ohm; also R3034.

BTW, R3035/36 can't be present in this case.

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
That means you still have problems in UB300/400 area.
Inspect the terminals of USB-C connector.
Compare diode mode to ground readings on different points between left/right ports.
Be sure UB090 has good solders/traces and surrounding resistors OK.

Do you get PPBUS_G3H voltage when connect the battery?
Try with known good battery.
All USB-C ports still remain on 5V then?

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message: does this device work without batteries?

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
It should get PPBUS_G3H at least, without battery.
Testing with battery in this case may help to see if there is other problem, apart of USB-C area.

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
F7000= PPBUS_G3H =no voltage 

no voltage with or without battery

I read 5 volts on FB201, shouldn't it be 20 volts here?

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
FB200/1 will get 20V only after correct communication between SMC and charger.

No voltage on PPBUS_G3H means there is other problem, apart of USB-C area.
I supposed the battery data cable was also connected and battery still holds some charge.

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
So what will I check? What should I check for PPBUS_G3H voltage?

What should I check between SMC and charger

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
Seems that your board suffered more damage than expected; because of liquid spill.
You still have problems on UB300/400 area, but also somewhere else.
Possibly SMC got bad, if you don't get PPBUS_G3H at all; nor even with battery connected.

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
I understand that the absence of PPBUS_G3H has nothing to do with CBs. you say PPBUS_G3H should be output anyway, but is this a definite SMC problem?
in a similar problem, smc and 4xCB were changed, the problem was not resolved

[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/820-00928-5v-looping-one-side-only.59983/[/URL]

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
Changing the chips can't assure the board repair.
Broken traces, bad solders, corroded passive components (caps, resistors, coils), can block the correct communication.
Also accumulated crap under BGA chips can cause leakage between balls.

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
There was corrosion in the u2890 area. And the r2890 was not in place. I had cleaned that area before and replaced the r2890. Could the R2890 be broken?

[MEDIA=youtube]vXAK2l1oMZM:820[/MEDIA]

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
Replace corroded resistors, check traces and solders; for U2890 and also UB090.
You can compare diode mode readings between both chips.

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
PPBUS_G3H Isn't the u7000 considered defective because it has no voltage?

I injected voltage into the f7000 from the outside. There is no short circuit. no hot parts

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
U7000 requires correct communication with SMC, to generate correct PPBUS_G3H voltage.

Injecting voltage into a power rail where you don't have short, or incorrect resistance to ground, doesn't help at all.
Did you test the board with known good battery (holding some charge)?

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
It has a 5 volt cycle

I noticed that the capacitor I just marked has a short circuit with ground. I can't see this field in boardview.[ATTACH type="full"]60332[/ATTACH]

title: 820-00928-A spillage of liquid No power no charge
message:
I think that was already mentioned on the forum as being normal.
This is one of the reasons I said the people to read EACH forum thread and take notes when important information appears!

In case of 5V cycle, you should check for short, or low value on all secondary power rails.
However, I'm afraid you have a lost caused here, because of liquid damage...
